reviews_data.review_text: Wanted to thank Tyler and his staff for the amazing hospitality and customer service. The food was great and the atmosphere speaks for itself. Upstairs is really comfortable so as of today go see Tyler and his staff. üôèüèæ
Hands down the best vegan breakfast I've ever had! So nice to eat at a place where every item can be made vegan! Their golden chai latte was also amazing and such good prices. Highly recommend!
Barista was rude and couldn't follow instructions. ‚ÄúFor here‚Äù means that you want to have it at the store.
Authentic coffee! They housed an area with local beers. Most days I drop by for an iced latte with extra shot and lavender.. some days I do for sour beer!

I stopped by on a layover and was pleasantly surprised by their expansive vegan selection. I had a vegan bacon, egg, sausage, and cheese sandwich with Queen sauce‚Äî that was delicious- and an oat milk latte. Service was quick, the vibes were chill, and my food was great! I'll definitely be back to try more options as well as some lunch items.
I love their core values and vegan breakfast sandwiches
Awesome vegan options and Chai lattes!
Nitro latte is very good!  Not too sweet but packs a punch.  Easy parking in the sky house parking deck.  They will validate up to 2 hours with QR code scannable tickets when you exit the deck.

Love the atmosphere of the cafe. I like getting a coffee and sitting in the top floor to relax on the weekend mornings. Very quiet for the most part. We also found the art on the wall to be super intriguing and even purchased a piece.

Don't really do "fancy coffee" but the folks I was helping pet sit for only had "really fancy coffee makers" and this was a quick walk.  Super helpful and friendly staff that offered up some great Guatamalan drip coffee. (I guess that just means regular)  It's REALLY GOOD!  Oven was broken so no food and the Americana is also pretty damn fantastic.  I won't ever go out of my way to come Uptown, but if I am ever staying a block away again, it will definitely be an every morning thing as it has been.
The best part of my mornings!

Coffee was great, bagels were great!  Unfortunately, the oven was down during our visit so we couldn't try most of the food items, but there were still enough options available.  Staff was extremely friendly and helpful.  There is a cute wall of "Pay It Forward" tickets where people have purchased drinks and left little notes for those in need of a pick me up.
They were out of a lot of items when we went but the coffee and tea were very good, as well as the food!
A solid cafe. Friendly staff and two floors with a comfy atmosphere.

Queen City Grounds is my favorite coffee shop in the City of Charlotte. The staff know how to make some of the best lattes I've ever tried. QCG is also one of the few places in the Charlotte area that you can get a fully vegan breakfast. You could easily spend the whole day here with the breakfast, lunch, dinner offerings. Also a great place to spend a nice evening with local craft beers or seltzers from Summit. All around one of my favorite places in CLT. If you haven't gone here then you are missing out.  Pic is the Barvecue special sammie. It's not currently on the normal menu but maybe in the future???
Good options for coffee and food. Friendly ambiance. Vegan options also available!
$8 for a basic latte ü§¢ Do not reccomend. There are so many places to get better coffee for a cheaper price.
Nice place to grab fresh coffee, homemade breakfast sandwiches, and they do gluten free

This is the best authentic cappuccino you're going to find in Charlotte. A lot of the credit also goes to the barista who knows the proper milk to espresso ratio and milk foam consistency. It is also served in a ceramic mug as it should be. After a 1.5 year search this ranks at the top of my coffee shop list. BRAVO  Price: $4.00
Fantastic cold brew and very friendly staff
One of the only places in Uptown that has vegan breakfast sandwiches! It's tasty and just what I need when I'm running late for work. The coffee is delicious too!
Great coffee and plant based options

UPDATE: My experience here has changed and now I've rated Queen City Grounds a 5! I've recently gotten the Impossible burger and the chicken sand-which and both are amazing. I recommend the ranch on both. The service has been much better and the food comes out in a timely manner. The staff is very friendly. Definitely give this place a try!  My experiences have been really bad. The first time I ordered a breakfast burrito, it took 45 minutes. They had given food to everyone else that ordered after me. I asked for a status update. Instead of telling me they lost my order or forgot, they just said they were still working on it. How? The second time I went, I ordered online, because I had a little puppy with me. I was working outside, since they had signs on their window saying they can't allow dogs inside. When I ordered online I asked in the comments for them to bring it outside since I can't come in. I waited 30 minutes, before realizing that they must not be bringing it outside. When I went in my order was sitting at the pick up window and they just ignored the note I wrote even though it was printed on the receipt. The sandwich was cold and soggy by the time I got it. Customer service is not their forte. I wanted to support their partnership with Summit Seltzer and new opening at night hours, but they need to work on customer service.

Coffee was great the front desk cashier was polite and chipper. The food I ordered was one thing online but different on the menu in the cafe. So I got the BLT but couldn't find any bacon on my first half of the sandwich but then I took it apart for the staff to show them I couldn't find Bacon. They showed me a tiny piece on the other half only and didn't seem to want to make another. If you're working on a menu and the first ingredient is bacon, you might expect to have a visible portion on the sandwich. Side note the online menu said on toast but the menu here was on a veggie wrap. Last part of my rant the item said thick cut bacon, the piece we found on one half was the same you see at Subway that's thin and small. I'll try again some other time, the menu looks great and has a lot of appealing options. The building is beautiful and they have a great decor. Thanks for the coffee y'all it was wonderful.
One of the best in town, will definitely come again. Very balanced latte taste, served in large ceramic mugs.

Their house coffee blend strikes a deep-toned flavor bell for me. It's just my personal favorite. And the creative barista blends are nicely balanced between coffee, dairy, flavor. But please don't go because I want all the fabulous seating, music, reading/working vibe all to myself. I can tell by their actions over time that the management has a soul. Thanks for supporting CBA students and family and your community in general. Please keep making your creamy grits‚Äîbut I only get them when I'm not on the run because you must be cooking them on the stove just for me. üôÇ
Great food options for all sorts (including vegan / vegetarian) & coffee is good is well. Great atmosphere!
My favorite coffee in charlotte!! Well trained baristas and good quality coffee beans, would recommend the flat white! The place atmosphere is enjoyable and relaxing.

I work in the area and love to pop by Queen City Grounds (which is currently rebranding to become 'The Landing') and grab a bite to eat or some caffeine. My favorites include the Soul Glo and Simple Life bagel sandwiches - which both have vegan options!

Used to have delcious vegan breakfast. Last month I noticed they messed up the order of a couple. I noticed and suggested the manager to give them store credit and he ignored me. Fast forward to today, my vegan egg burrito was missing eggs. Basically raw onions in a wrap. Disgusting tasting. I expected them to give me a store credit or something to make up for it. I am not going to ask for it. Nothing kills like success. RIP fav vegan place.
Spacious neighborhood coffeeshop with great espresso and the best breakfast burrito in Charlotte (The Burrito You Want)
Fantastic cappuccino & matcha latte (added lavender, it was AMAZING). Will definitely be back!

I went to their location off of North Church Street on 12 August 2022, at approximately 9:15. 1. The lady with red dye in her hair was not friendly when she took my order, not rude, but clearly dismissive. 2. She ended up writing my name down wrong for the order I guess, so I obviously didn't respond when they called my name (there were plenty of other guest, figured it was theirs). Not a big deal, but the same lady finally came up to me (red dyed hair) and said ‚Äúwe've called your name like 5 times‚Äù as she delivered the coffee to our table, in the most disrespectful way possible. Then proceeded to roll her eyes as she walked off. 3. I clearly didn't know what name that they had down so the same thing happened for my food except she got my attention hollered at me to come get the food. Not a big deal, except, I finally mentioned that I think you got my name wrong, to which again she rolled her eyes and another staff joked that ‚Äúit's such a big deal‚Äù 4. Our drinks were labeled wrong (it was two drinks), so we each took a sip of each other's drink.  Lastly, one of these issues not a big deal, I get it people have bad days. But the lady with the red dyed hair is truly not meant for this job and this establishment will no longer get my business. I was a frequent customer, not anymore, this is pathetic.
Excellent coffee üëçüèª Flat white was just PERFECT ü§ç perfect place to relax

Such a cute coffee shop! We were visiting Charlotte for the weekend and we're so happy we stopped in Queens City Grounds to start our day. Two stories with lots of seating options to work or study. Their staff was friendly and fast. The cold brew was great and I also enjoyed a delicious breakfast bagel sandwich. Their Pay It Forward wall was such an amazing concept to foster kindness ‚ú®Ô∏è

The coffee and breakfast sandwich were delicious. I loved the atmosphere. I really enjoyed the lay it forward wall. Such a great way to bring the community together. It's also in a really cute park of town with historical homes.

Good food and drinks, one issue is with online orders. If you order both food and drink online they only print the order at the drink station and you'll have to ask for them to make the food. I ordered online and waited 45 minutes in store for the order to be ready because of the ordering disconnect.
Great coffee and atmosphere!
Great place to sit and have coffee while knocking out some work. Aesthetic is pleasing, seasonal menu's are good (especially Autumn), and good customer service. A little pricey but worth it!
Unbelievably good vegan options. Great music, great coffee, really cool atmosphere, huge fan of this place.
The Sweet Victory and Golden Chai make a good pairing!  There's good music playing here and the barista was very welcoming to my tired soul!
Great coffee, hippy interiors and lots of space to sit and hang out.
Good coffee
Hands down best breakfast burrito in town and it's not even close.

I completely fell in love with this place! The fact that they have vegan options and just eggs makes it better! I wish we would have found this sooner because we would have of ate breakfast here everyday for our stay !

This place is my new favorite local Vegan friendly takeout spot for breakfast! They not only have options for non Vegans, but for those of us who are Vegan or willing to try it they've got LOTS of options for us which include a given number of specifically Vegan menu items, but the reality is that anything on their menus can be customized to your preference. They also sell my friend Morathi's product Kikaboni Sea Moss gel. I ‚ù§Ô∏è You Queen City Grounds!!!
Friendly staff, great coffee and gluten-free/vegan options!
If you have the chance to get the Nitro Latte, it's going to be worth it.
Known for its coffee I guess but, the tea here is just as amazing. Real leaf selection and best of all it's a great place to hangout and cycle to.
Best coffee ever, good service and the staff with the best vibes

Great hot espresso but iced espresso (americano) tasted superrrr burnt and they were out of cold brew by 11am on Saturday. Very cute interior, great attentive staff. Food menu only displayed at the register (would suggest putting it on the wall), and the food is quite expensive for being so average (the bagel is mediocre and too salty, and tasted like a Dunkin sandwich). Personally, I wouldn't return, but it's quite convenient for the area.
Pretty average coffee at average price. Very slow every time I go there and doesn't take call in orders. Online ordering system is chownow which up charges you to place an order in advance.

I am leaving 1 star because I have to.  Worst experience in all my history of coffee shops.  The guy (who I thought was maybe a female...no name tag) at the register stood there pushing buttons on the register when I arrived appearing to be very busy despite the fact I was the only customer in line or waiting.  He didn't say "one moment" "I will be right with you" or "can I help you".  I am a nice guy, so I did not interrupt.  I stood there waiting for him to finish and after about 5 minutes, I assumed the machine was broke.  So, I spoke up and politely asked, "can I place the order and pay in cash (no change needed).  He then looked up and very smugly said, "I'm waiting on you to order, what do you want".  I was instantly annoyed but, like I said, I'm a nice guy and let it go.  I politely apologized for the confusion and ordered my drink.  He was very rude.  Didn't tell me a total, flipped the screen around and walked away.  He whispered several times to the female making the drinks and they just kept looking at me laughing.  When it was done, he grabbed the drink and sat it on the pick up counter and walked away without saying anything.  The drink was horrible having purposely been sabotaged by the female under the man's instruction.  It wasn't an innocent mistake where it was not hot enough or too sweet.  It was not drinkable AT ALL.  I threw the drink away, looked at both of them, and walked out.  I sent two white coworkers there immediately after I left and they did not have the same experience and much better cups of coffee.  In that regard, clearly an isolated incident of racism.  Just a heads up to Management who may or may not be condoning this despicable behavior....this does not stop at my review.  I will be reporting this establishment and incident to the BBB, Chamber, CA, and any other platform to ensure everyone knows what to expect when visiting Queen City Grounds.
It's great place for breakfast. Very delicious food  üòã
One of the best vegan burgers I've tasted

Coffee is great, but service is always incredibly slow - especially morning service. I've placed to go orders 10-15 minutes before arrival with hope that I could pick up before I go into office. It has never worked. I end up waiting 10+ minutes each time as they prepare my order.
Great customer service and good coffee. Clean

I like to come here to work sometimes. I work remotely, and it's nice to change up the scenery. There's plenty of seating options for a casual coffee with friends, a work meeting, or working from a laptop. I typically sit upstairs because it's more quiet. Their draft oat milk latte is my favorite, they rotate the flavors. I've eaten breakfast and lunch here before, everything I've had to eat is also good. I've gotten it to go plenty of times also and you can order online which is convenient.

This place is probably the best coffee in charlotte and the hot chocolate is one of the best I've had! They have plenty of vegan breakfast options and will typically offer a vegan pastry, I would recommend trying the crimson raider. The atmosphere inside is really nice and there is plenty of room to sit and hang out

Never fails! Drinks are always creative and delicious, and the food is a star. Does all the little things right, and nail it each time they swing for the fences with a wild special/new item. A personal favorite for sure.  EDIT MARCH 3 2022 :  Still rules.
Best coffee in Charlotte!!! Great vibe, service and foodüíïüíïüíï

Friendly and entertaining staff Cozy atmosphere. Smells DELICIOUS. Beer,  seltzer,  wine, coffee and some incredibly yummy looking sandwiches ( they must be amazing because every other person was eating )
Excellent staff excellent latte
Great options for vegans!
Perfect coffee while traveling the US. Breakfast begel was delicious too.
Please bring back the Gocudang BLT üò≠üò≠üò≠üò≠üò≠
Great staff and environment.
Excellent cappuccino and drip coffee. Definitely try any one of the burritos. Superstar staff members.
really good black coffee, and the food is spectacular. the atmosphere is really cozy as well, and the seating area available is comfortable and relaxing.

Delicious breakfast burrito, probably the best I've had, great ingredients (eggs, bacon, advocado and more),  loved the spicyness.  Very good vibe, great place to have breakfast or your coffee in a relaxing atmosphere.
Overpriced for just ok coffee. The food options look good

If you're looking for a place that serves fantastic coffee made with love, care, and passion, look no further. Queen City Grounds definitely has the coffee game on lock in Charlotte. The Flat White I had was simply the best cup of coffee I've had outside of my own home. It also helps that they roast their coffee beans in-house to meticulous quality.  The staff is super friendly, the coffee shop is always super clean, they also have some pretty tasty sandwiches, and the upstairs loft has some of the best views of Fourth Ward.  Come on in. Get a cup. Do some of that work you've been wanting to get done or just chill out for a while. On your way out, buy a bag of their beans to take home. And yes, they will happily grind it up for you.
It's good
So cute and really nice staff!
Great place to get a cup of coffee or a quick bite to eat. Staff is very friendly. My go to coffee shop uptown.
"Easily 40x better than Starbucks" - girlfriend. She loves their cold brew, I like their strawberry banana smoothies, and their burrito is out of this world.

After a morning hike i decided to have local coffee and I searched for it and came through Queen City Grounds. It was a nice small coffee shop with different people buying coffee on Sunday morning. The parking can be an issue as it has a road parking and sometimes you may not get the place. The ambience of the cafe was amazing and i loved the vibes. The menu is amazing and has different coffee options. I ordered Cappuccino hot coffee. I got the order quickly and it was amazing. I loved the coffee. Do try this as it is an amazing place.

Stopped in for some coffee to go, and was quite amazed at what a cool spot this is. The coffee is fine, if a bit expensive, but the location as a spot to relax, study, read or get some work done is quite exemplary. It's well appointed, with lots of comfy places to sit, and various excellent views. Next time I'm in the area and need a place to hang out for a bit, I'd definitely return!
Solid cup o Joe and an awesome atmosphere to hang out or get some work done!

My Chai Latte was perfect, and the young lady working there was extremely kind and professional. She even gave me advice on places to check out in Charlotte. The views from this Uptown coffee joint are pleasant and sweet. But the coffee is sweeter. ‚òïÔ∏è

Haven't tried the coffee yet because I still havent gotten it after 30 minutes of ordering 2 iced lattes. The guy taking my order today seemed like he didnt want to be there, he was asking people if they wanted cream or sugar and then after someone replied cream please, he told them to go get it themselves at the self serve bar. Whats the point? Customer service alone is a 1 or 2 out of 5. Lets see how the coffee is.  Got the coffee. One was 4 shots, iced whole milk. The other 3 shots, iced, oat milk. I asked the dark curly haired barista if the milks were correct in the drinks (dairy intolerance) and she literally said, "I forget at this point". Not coming back, maybe find better baristas who care about the craft. I paid around $13 and a $2 tip.
The best coffee in Charlotte.

New to the Charlotte and received a welcome packet with coupons from various restaurants and such in the area.  Queen City Grounds had a gift certificate for $10 in the packet, so we stopped by and ordered the Chai drink.  It was fabulous and went back again this week.  You've gained a new customer with your marketing coupon.  Thank you!
Best draft cold brew I have ever had
We just ordered take out but the atmosphere was amazing, will definitely be coming back to enjoy the place and the food and drinks.
A well run and trendy coffee shop that had excellent Nitro brew on tap. Stop by if you're in the area for sure!
Omg the corn chips in my breakfast burrito were amazing!! Nice and spicy. Perfect cappuccino.

Service was quick, and the grit bowl was INCREDIBLE. Very filling and great portion size. I was only visiting for a couple days, but it was some of the best coffee we had while in the city! The ‚ÄúLe Tigre‚Äù was very unique and delicious!

Our favorite local CLT Coffee shop! Not only do they have an amazing coffee lineup but rotating specialty coffee drinks (plus non coffee drinks too) AND made to order breakfast. My favorite breakfast burritos!
Been going here for so long. Love that they have so many vegan options!
Best coffee in Charlotte! Iced vanilla oat milk latte is one of the best I've ever had! And the service is always friendly and welcoming. Highly recommend!!

found this spot a few weeks back (was referred by Central Coffee since they didn't yet allow seating). spacious, clean & a friendly staff (special shout out to Kiara), this is one of my favorite coffee joints. I especially appreciate the seating options (tables, counter by the bar, comfy lounge- upstairs). oh yeah, the wifi is aces & they got plenty of outlets for juicing your electronics. gracias guys :)

I love the atmosphere of this place! It always takes me a while to order. The staff are always very patient. It is a little pricey but my food always comes out piping hot and the coffee is DELICIOUS! I recommend the Fast Times at Vegan High sandwich. Sooo delish!

I love QCG! The coffee is delicious- I suggest the cold brew with oat milk! The food is made to order, tasty and they have a lot vegetarian options. Inclusive place and all are welcome. This atmosphere is delightful! They've recently added some great new tables outside and we get to comfortably bring our dog along now too!
Yummy vegan option food and good coffee. Great vibe as well with a decent amount of indoor seating. Would recommend!
My go-to coffee shop whenever I am in Charlotte. Love the cappuccino there
Confession - ‚ÄúI am a coffee snob‚Äù. Ok all clear, this shop rocks. Best cortado in NC! Great work guys! 10-10 ‚ù§Ô∏èüëåüèºüôå
Mango smoothie was delicious. Kind people.
Super good flavor profiles ! Great place to eat & get work done ! üî•

Honestly, after one trip, this might just be my favorite spot for a quiet and relaxing breakfast to ease into the morning. Dining as a pair, and getting two wraps, two drinks, and a cinnamon bun... everything totaled about $35. Well-worth the price tag.  The highlight was Alexisonfire. Petey the Pistol was also good, but felt like something was missing from it. Hot sauce fixes just about all problems, so it just got better once it was applied. Queen City Grounds will be a recurring pitstop in the AM, and I recently learned that there are multiple locations.  Don't shy away from Queen City Grounds if you know what's good for you.
Friendly staff, great menu including delicious vegan options.
Awesome matcha latte and my date decided to be adventurous and order the same. He is super picky and he enjoyed it as well! Also got a cool owl sticker at the register!
Caramel latte is great here

I'm so happy I found this place! In order to be more eco-friendly and reduce waste I've been getting coffee beans from a grocery store using my own clean bag. In an effort to be more supportive of local business I reached out through fb to see if I'd be able to do the same at their shop. I received a quick and helpful response and ended up stopping by that same day.  I was able to purchase fresh roasted coffee beans and enjoyed a slice of delicious vegan coffee cake.... in my own container! They have lots of vegan options and everyone was super friendly. I'll definitely be returning. Please check them out!
Good latte

Y'all, if you want the best breakfast burritos and the freshest coffee in CLT, this is your spot. The Vegan Alexis on Fire burrito is my go-to fav...and I'm not even vegan! Give this place a visit. You won't be disappointed.
Good coffee, Great food. A vegan paradise.
Great coffee, loved the layout and the upstairs seating!
amazing vegan burgers and great seating

great coffee and food. caramel latte with extra caramel and oat milk is my go to. breakfast sandwiches are Soo good, I recently tried their crimson raider with firecracker sauce üòã (sn: it's like sriracha spicy not super hot).they get fresh drop offs from local vegan bakery MovingThatDough on Saturday and Sundays like cinnamon rolls, specialty donuts and other goodies. parking can be a little spotty. they validate parking in deck next door, ask when placing order. spots in front meters were closed off so will run risk a ticket parking right in front wish there was easier,more convenient parking to run in and go. overall awesome local coffee spot with great food choices.
Wow. Nice coffee shop in town. They roast on site, plenty of seating, and had great service. I had a chai tea latte on this day. Very well done.

Good dirty chai. Room to sit down. Patient (enough) staff. Decor interesting enough to occupy a lonely traveler. Not a lot of social interaction between strangers. Not packed on a Sunday. Far from my home of south Florida this coffee shop has enough flare to occupy the mind of an urban traveler. Queen City does not mean it focuses on lgbtq++ but it is inclusive of them. There is one leather couch upstairs all the way at the end around the corner. I would have liked them to be a bit snobbier but I'm sure in in the minority there. I would have liked an opportunity to interact with the locals but this was not a talkative environment. Might be the covid. Might just be the atmosphere.

The coffee is delicious - smooth, and fairly strong. Great space too - sit by the window and look at Church St, one of the most beautiful sections of uptown Charlotte. Avoid the baked goods though - they are not baked in-house and are overwhelmingly sweet with no rea flavour. Would be much better to just get products from Amelie's or another excellent nearby bakery if they can't bake their own.
Not happy with attitude. But the coffee is okay.

This is an excellent coffee shop on the outskirts of the city. Street parking nearby is rarely an issue, and you can count on great customer service. The last few times I have been here, I have ordered a mocha and a latte. Great taste, although I wish the milk was steamed longer (I like mine hot!) Regardless the food and atmosphere are great!

This place had a nice atmosphere. I ordered the deluxe grilled cheese and it tasted like it was mostly just bread, a little disappointed. It seemed like everything vegan had an up-charge which always sucks. Boyfriend and I thought it was a little too pricey for what you get.
Nice vibe to the place , stayed for a little over an hour to play scrabble and drink coffee

This was part of the reason I chose an Airbnb in uptown while Visiting Charlotte... I walked every morning I could to this coffee shop. The coffee is so delicious there and it's such a cute space in a great neighborhood.
Stopped by with our family to pick up some coffee for Thanksgiving weekend. Great feel and environment.
Asked for coffee and was told ‚Äú sorry dude, We just ran out. ‚Äú Couldn't make more! Dude? Pretty lousy. Morehead location
I LOVE COFFEE!!!!!!!!!!!!. PERIOD.
Cozy atmosphere, sane prices, good coffee. Great study spot.
Breakfast burrito is a must get. Seasonal drinks are okay. Lunch is great. Lots of vegan gf stuff. Slightly on the pricey side but worth it.

This is a nice coffee shop, very clean, very spacious.. parking can be a bear since it's paid street spaces but it's usually not too full in the late mornings. coffee is smooth and well roasted and staff is great. this is a great addition to Uptown!
They dont take cash, and were quite rude about it

Im a bit of a coffee snop. I was a barista for 10 years and moved to NC about 18 months ago. Hands down the best coffee I've had since moving here. Plus they have an amazing food menu. I am a vegetarian and they had several options to choose from. They even have local natural soaps, shampoo bags, etc. Eco-friendly, local, veggie options. Plus the place itself is large, industrial modern. A must go too 100/100 for me. Well done!
Great vegan food. Starbucks-like atmosphere/ vibe.
Nice staff good coffee tasty food üëçüèº

Stopped by for a quick bite to eat while passing through Charolette - a good vegan breakfast sandwich is hard to find but we found 2 at Queen City Grounds!  I ordered the Legend of Zelda (because how can I not?) and my wife ordered the Fast Times at Vegan High and both were LEGIT.  On top of that the staff were super friendly and laid back. The whole vibe was really great. I'm making a point to stop back the next time I'm in town.
Great coffee! Great service an excellent selection of food. If you love coffee don't miss this shop.
Cool atmosphere and great coffee. I wish they opened earlier that 8 AM so I can get coffee go to the gym and get to work at 830 AM.
A little pricey, but the staff is nice and the muffins are tasty.

I'm a former barista and am always looking for the best coffee made in house and the best beans for home brewing.  After trying many other roasters local and abroad located in various parts of the US, I always find myself coming back to QCG for the sure shot.  Their coffee is reliably consistent for great taste where the notes described are always evident in every cup where I never have once found any bland, unpleasant, or  ‚Äústale‚Äù tastes I find often in other coffees.  Whatever you're doing keep doing it!

What a blessing ‚ù£to have everything you desire at your fingertips. My go to is the homemade caramel sauce latte and my daughters is the matcha latte. We are thrilled with their vegan menu. We're trying a different item each time and haven't been disappointed. I look forward to many future visits. Queen City Grounds has been a blessing to our Fourth Ward neighborhood.
This the goatü§© We ordered latte and cappuccino. Both of 2 drinks tasted so good. Luv it
Great customer service and perfect atmosphere to work or relax. Excellent sandwiches as well. Love a coffee shop where I can also grab a great lunch!
Great place and awesome atmosphere
Great location. We stopped after lunch by on a Sunday. Sat outside and enjoyed an iced Americano. Was nice to see others out and about.

I called to ask when the location below me was going to open. Adam said hopefully soon. I told him I was a resident and he insisted on bringing me a cup because he was on the way. Wow. Great Service and some great coffee. Support this Team. Thanks Again!!!
Awesome feel and great menu. Everyone is nice and treats you with respect. Food doesn't take long and huge hot cold selections. Overall atmosphere and team is great!
Had one of the best wraps I've ever eaten
Great food and the coffee is incredible!

Order: Cappuccino, Drip Coffee, Grits Bowl, Fall Toast Price: $19 Positives: Seating, espresso, they roast their own coffee Negatives: No pour overs (WHY DOES THIS CITY HATE POUR OVERS)? tldr: Queen City Grounds has fantastic coffee and one for the best interior spaces I've ever had the pleasure of drinking coffee in. Dispute their lack of a pour over I'd highly recommend Queen City and an exceptional cafe.  Thoughts: So if you read my reviews in order you know that I drove to this coffee shop from another coffee shop. Yes, we have a problem. Queen City Coffee was our second stop that day and a location we had planned to spend some time at working. It was actually very busy when we came in but we still managed to find some seating upstairs, and since I mentioned it, I definitely want to talk about their seating.  They don't have a massive amount of seating, but you could definitely get 30 to 50 people in this place without it feeling overly crowded. I think what really makes it feel less cramped is that the different places to sit are divided up around the shop. They have an upstairs area, a downstairs area, and several out of the way ‚Äúnooks‚Äù around the shop.. It really makes it feel like you're not in a crown even if there are a lot of people there. This would be a fantastic place to work or read while drinking your coffee  Now that we've talked about the space, let's move onto their coffee. They roast their own beans, which is a huge plus because it lets them control exactly what they want in their coffee. Once again I found myself unable to order a pour over which was even more bizarre at this cafe because they are a full blown coffee shop. It sort of left me wondering if Charlotte just hates pout overs. Anyway we got drip coffee, and one of their seasonal fall lattes. The flavors for both were excellent. The latte was very well crafted, it wasn't overly sweet and you definitely got that taste of espresso. The drip coffee was good, but it almost left me wanting a pour over because I think that would've pulled out the flavor more.  Since we knew we would be there for a while we also ordered one of their toasts, and a grit bowl. Both of them were killer! The grit bowl was very warm, hearty, and filling without feeling overly greasy or cheesy. The toast was one of the few toast I've ever seen my wife order that I also would have ordered. Most of the time toast is this weird artsy slice of toast and a little bit of something-or-other on top. Most of the time it kind of just annoys me that someone is charging eight dollars for toast and half an avocado. At Queen City Grounds this wasn't the case. It was a thick, flavorful piece of toast that tasted fantastic, had good body, and tasted homemade. You could really taste what was going on in the bread itself. Then it had this balsamic glaze on top with goat cheese and was really just out of this world. That's a very rare thing for me to say about toast so great job Queen City!  Clearly I haven't visited even a fraction of the coffee shops that Charlotte has to offer but of the three that I went to I think this is the winner. The seating and space is fantastic, their food is great, and their coffee was really good, reagardles of the fact that for some insane reason they don't do pour overs.  I know that my wife and I would both find ourselves here on multiple occasions to get work done or just hang out drink coffee and read.
BEST COFFEE & Brunch place this side of the Mississippi. Good food, good prices and amazing staff. They also very active in feeding homeless community. 5üåü
Love this shop. Clean. Good design. Kind staff.
Love this place! I come here all the time to work on homework and it's such a nice and welcoming environment. 10/10 recommend.
Really nice place to work out of. Wish I lived closer.

Lovely atmosphere, everyone seemed very chill and nice. I swung by after my doctor's appointment around the corner and was really pleasantly surprised. I got a flat white with soy milk and it was smooth, rich, and velvety. Would highly recommend if you're in the area.
Great coffee, great staff, great atmosphere, and short they're great!
Amazing atmosphere.
Best coffee in uptown Charlotte. Love their decaf cortado.
I love the vibe of this spot. It also accommodates a vegan lifestyle and it has a lot of natural products. Lastly, the customer service was above what I expected. Great place!!

Very nice setting for meet and greets, work, or just hanging out.  The breakfast burritos are excellent and always well made.  I drink drip coffee so I can't say about the fancy coffee's.  My only complaint or suggestion is to post the store's hours when a holiday or other event comes up.  I have come here a few times to be told they were closing (odd hours).  No note on the door to warn you.  That's small.  Otherwise this is a really nice place to hang out.
Really cute coffee shop & friendly staff. Delicious vanilla latte costs about $5. Seating is slightly limited but a nice place to sit and study.
This is the best coffee I've had in Charlotte. Staff is super friendly and helpful, and the food is delicious. Make time to go!
Locally owned cafe with a comfortable feel and delicious coffee and food.  I love the gochujang BLT!   Plenty of seating for working or hanging out.
Cold Brew was excellent

This spot has become my #1 go-to for work. I work remotely and finding an environment that is conducive to my productivity‚Äîbut that I also feel comfortable enough in to spend my entire day and week in‚Äîwas difficult when I first moved to Charlotte. But this place hits every mark for me: an open layout with tons of natural light, a lot of variety in seating options, a chill but professional ambiance, GREAT food(seriously try the BLT), and good drink options. Would definitely recommend this as a good place to study, get work done, or have a lunch meeting.
Friendly service and great coffee
Great coffee and ambiance!!
Great spot for coffee small breakfast items and more!
Nitro coffee was delicious.  Wish they served breakfast all day.

Really good, good vibe etc  But the place, I'm sorry, has a pungent smell from the eggs cooking.  C'mon figure this out and fix it-all the other places have.  It is unbearable-so much so I had to write this review now, less than 30 mins into my visit (2nd one).  Wish you the best but I would not return with this smell much more :(  Edit update: The place is easily a 5 star.  Amazing location in Charlotte, one of the best spots I've been to (not just in Charlotte) and very chill, really what a coffee place should be.  Thanks for the great job :)
My best places to be thr for a Sunday brunch. Best coffee in the town.
The coffee is excellent. I absolutely love the bagels here (if I am lucky enough to get one).  Definitely a step up from "chain" coffee shops.
There are two things I look for in a coffee shop: good coffee and a relaxing atmosphere. The lattes here are excellent and the atmosphere is also really good. I will definitely be going back.
Great house blend, friendly staff, really cool atmosphere.
Ordered mocha and vanilla latte, so very excellent. Pretty foam design and real cocoa and vanilla used with the esspresso, yumm! Ill be  back, mucho grande better than sbucks
Burrito was amazing.
Great place to grab a great latte!üëç

Modern place with a nice atmosphere and good drinks. Chai Tea Latte was sweetened just right with a ton of yummy cinnamon goodness on top. They have restrooms downstairs for customers & a nice hang out area upstairs. They also have food; we had the pumpkin cronut and pretzel. Some cool memorabilia (t-shirts etc) with their owl logo on them for sale - great souvenirs!
The strawberry Brie toast and breakfast burrito are both amazing. And the coffee is really good too.
Excellent flat white!
The carmel latte is my favorite!  Its relaxing to go and have meet ups with friends lawyers professionals or to just think!
Good vibes and good people.
I came here expecting to find good coffee and was surprised to find amazing food as well. A cool atmosphere and friendly staff  make this a place worth stopping by for breakfast one day.
Way overpriced! The coffee is horrible. The coffee roaster is a joke. You can't roast good coffee out of that toy.

I stopped here on the way back to Virginia. While in line a homeless person approached me and asked if I could get them a soda. I told them I would, and when I got to the counter the girl at the cashier over heard the conversation and took care of it for me. Just small acts of kindness like that helps grow a community. Always great to see it within businesses. Also, the expresso was top knotch üëç
Phenomenal coffee.
Quick friendly service,  great food, comforting and chill environment, unique and eclectic
Their coffee and breakfast are really good and the best thing about this place is their set up. I love the layout of the shop and the upstairs has a cute area with board games :)
Love this coffee shop! They have the most talented and friendly baristas. Coffee is roasted in-house and they have a revolving food menu. It is a relaxing place to work or meet friends.
Cool place...great coffee...helpful staff!  And the views of the downtown area are available on two sides with 20-or-so foot windows doing the offering.  I'll return.
I just ordered a golden chai latte and it was so delicious ü§ó. Also, the staff is helpful and friendly.
Fun atmosphere,  quiet enough to have a conversation. Had the match a lemonade and it was delicious
Good location, interesting variations of sandwiches and beverages. Sandwiches are big enough that you can split. Pretty quiet on Sunday afternoon which actually nice, will come back!
One of my favorite shops uptown. Nice open atmosphere, not too busy, but still cozy. Excellent drinks.
Great coffee. Fast service. Try the apple cinnamon rolls, you won't be disappointed
‚òïÔ∏è
Great service. Yummy food
My fav coffee shop in the city! Great food options, amazing coffee, and the friendliest staff! Great atmosphere to meet a friend or get some work done!
Quiet spot with great food and coffee
Love the coffee here! I wish there were more option for cup sizes! I want my iced latte in a bigger cup because it's so good!
Fantastic coffee shop.  Very bike friendly.  Lots of vegan options.

Clean with friendly clerks and good variety. If you have ever lived in a state where liquor sales were privatized, you realize how much better that system is, but as long as you have to live with archaic state run stores, this is as good as it gets.
Cute, delicious, great boutique buys and tshirts. Owner is very sweet. Lovely atmosphere
Their coffee is one of the best in Charlotte and I love all the vegan options they offer!

I've been wanting to try a kronut for so long now. I'd heard really good things about this place so we decided to come here for a Sugarman kronut.  It was really crowded when we got there and there were about 10 people in line in front of us.  We got a pecan pie kronut and a lemon blueberry donut from Move That Dough. The donut was just ok to me. I'm not a big cake donut person, so it was good for a cake donut. The kronut on the other hand was amazing! It was flaky and crispy. So good.  The interior is gorgeous. They have a lot of seating too. There's an upstairs balcony with more seating too.  I definitely would come back here. Their breakfast menu looked interesting too.

If you're looking for a quiet place downtown to get a few hours of work done or to have a small group meeting in a laidback yet modern atmosphere, look no further. Their breakfast & lunch menu is exceptional for a coffee shop too. The rancheros burrito and the chai latte are my go-to's! I highly recommend giving them a try.
Love this coffee shop! I used to work across the street and I really miss this place. Good food, cronuts, oatly, and weekly/daily specials. Great place for casual meetings or morning coffee.
Nice coffe shop close to mid city. Parking is tight if your in a big truck.
Best coffee shop in Charlotte. Great food and excellent atmosphere
Cappuccino was good but, you cannot serve a cappuccino in an Expresso cup.

Cool, hip coffee stop uptown off Church and 10th! Great coffee, knowledgeable friendly staff and an open two story feel with a small bar with a few craft beers to boot. Check it out on your next downtown visit!
Great coffee. Nice interior! Great staff! Terrible, just terrible food menu choices.ü§¢
This is my new favorite coffee shop in Charlotte. Try the pastries; they are different delicious. They also have upstairs seating
Great vibe, super friendly staff, tasty sandwich and smooth cold brew. No other box to check off. Will return

The GOCHUDANG-GOOD BLT is where it is at. Man, that thing changed my BLT world. Haven't tried any of the other lunch options. Coffee is on point and they have plenty of tables to get some work done. The upstairs loft area is nice and usually pretty quiet. Most people up there are plugged into their headphones, so if you need to do some computer work it's a good option.
Best chi tea I have ever had!
Love this place. except why does it close so early ?
Expensive however I really enjoyed my spring special. I've never considered green coffee before & I highly recommend it!

Loved visiting this roaster! Freshly brewed beans, friendly staff, gluten-free/vegan options available, and they even have a cool gift shop inside. We bought one of their awesome T-shirts, love the logo! Will definitely be back!
Fantastic latte. Have been there twice for coffee and both times were excellent. The baristas are friendly and do an awesome job.
Super friendly baristas! Great decaf espresso for the iced americanos!

I can't say enough good things about this place. Vegan options, they have locally sourced options, friendly staff, efficient staff, delicious food and more.  Keep up the great work and positive vibes!
Great atmosphere and wonderful service with unique seasonal choices that are both creative and unique.
The staff is always friendly and helpful the coffee is some of my favorite and the breakfast burritos are really tasty. They also have the added benefit of many vegan options.
Staff is always friendly and wonderful at making suggestions. They make the best oat milk latte EVER!

First time visiting this morning! Super cool shop! Lots of seating on 2nd level. Breakfast burrito was amazing. Latte was awesome. Parked in the parking deck next door and they validate your ticket so you can park for free üëçüèº

Love this cozy place, they have food and beer/wine. It can get crowded on weekends but people don't hang for too long. There's plenty of places to sit and upstairs has a library as well! The coffee is wonderful and there's plenty of options if you don't do dairy! The service was great. The people are so friendly and patient with explaining the menu.
Great coffee and great service.

Really fantastic atmosphere and the quality of the drinks and food is really impressive. The cold brew I had was some of the best I've ever experienced and the pastries tasted fresh. Music was the perfect noise level, lots of natural light and places to sit, just overall a really great start to my day. Thank you!

Visited today for lunch. Great atmosphere, excellent space to meet up with others or spend some alone time studying, reading a book, or just enjoying some good coffee.  I tried their jasmine Silver Needles green tea and had the BLT with a type of peanut sauce.  My coworker had some sort of red iced tea drink and a sandwich they made into a wrap for him.  It was all really tasty; not too heavy yet perfectly filling for a midday meal.  The establishment was very clean and comfortable.  I love the upscale yet cozy vibe they have going there.  The owl art on the wall is a fun touch and their upstairs seating area is perfect for some quiet space.  The staff were all very friendly and the service was fast.  Even though it was fairly busy, it wasn't too loud for me and my coworker to have a conversation. Really great place overall and I will definitely be back!

Great service from the staff and amazing locally roasted coffee. Highly recommend the Cortado with Oat Milk or the Cold Brew.  Lots of vegan options on site and plenty of space to meet with friends or study.

This place has some really good coffee. I love their ambience and the decor. The food was really good too. I liked how they had so many options. Its a great place for a relaxing or if plan to work or a small office meeting.
Awesome, Awesome, Awesome

This morning was my first time visiting this hot coffee spot. It had been highly recommended by friends. The coffee was delicious, the shop itself so cute and eclectic! And the staff was very friendly and helpful. Definitely worth the visit - the artwork is beautiful! (Also they have a fun nook upstairs with board games and activities.)
Great place! The menu is delicious and the space is beautiful. Can't wait to go back.
Great coffee & breakfast items. Employees are amazing as well!
I got coffee and food here for the four days I was in town because it was just that good!
Impressive presentation and a perfect environment to get work done
Coffee = Delicious F√ºd = Delicious Playlist = amazing Decor = wonderfully modern and unique Vibe = Inspiring If you havent been you NEED to go!

The staff were very nice however the caramel latt√© was not good and this place is EXTREMELY OVER PRICED for the quality of their product.. personally I won't be going back. A colleague of mine didn't like what she ordered either she said it was "less than mediocre" and she's an avid coffee drinker!

More than just coffee this place offers wonderful pastries (including cronuts) and light sandwiches for lunch.  This is the coffee shop you're looking for with lots of seating and well made coffee and food options.
Yummy and beautiful

I have had the pleasure of visiting here twice now. Each time the staff has been so nice! The vegan options are awesome. I have had the ranchero burrito for breakfast, a caramel oat milk latte, vegan pastries, and a special they called the McFib (vegan mcrib). Every thing has been delicious! They will validate parking up to 90 minutes for the parking garage as well. All the syrups are vegan as well. The environment inside the shop is very relaxed and chill. Don't miss out on this coffee shop!
FABulous beautiful coffee shop just off highway right downtown Charlotte!!!
This place is the best! Everyone who works here is so nice and the coffee is amazing. The food is also fantastic. Couldn't be happier that they're right across the street from where we live!

Ok so im a matcha fanatic, and ive had many matcha lattes in my day, this was the best ive had so far hands down. The color alone just shows you the quality. Also the balcony u can sit at is sooo cute. I would recomend this place for coffee for sure. I also had lunch and meh it was good but this is more of a coffee(or matcha) place.

We recently had our work holiday party at QCG and Adam, Heather, and Matt were awesome hosts! They made it all happen and it was so easy, they made great suggestions and put it into action to make for a great night! Awesome space and vibe, excellent food and drinks. Thanks again to everyone at Queen City Grounds. Would highly recommend for any event/gathering!
Nice coffee place. Interesting food options . Lot of comfy sitting .

My new go to for meetups! I've been here twice and from now on, I'm taking everyone I know. The diverse staff is so kind, helpful and professional. I met Adam (co-owner) on my last visit. I had no idea who he was at the time but he was so awesome that I later asked another employee and she told me. The overall vibe here is just amazing.  The caramel latte was the best that I've ever had. They have almond milk and oat milk if you prefer milk options that's aren't dairy. And the grit bowl!!!! OMG. I got it with tempeh and I can't wait to go back again. They have food options for vegans, vegetarians and carnivores including pastries.  They also sell small gifts including jewelry and greeting cards. They validate parking in the parking deck for 90 minutes. There is seating upstairs for overflow. You must go! Thank me later.

Fantastic food and coffee! The staff are always super friendly. There is an upstairs and downstairs with plenty of places to sit. The shop has a chic coffee-house vibe, but also has other things like a community bookshelf, board games, gifts on sale (jewelry, candles, crafts), wine and beer on tap, trivia nights and sometimes live music! The attention to detail is awesome. QCG is owned by a local family and the owners have obviously put a lot of love and attention into its operation.
Positively wonderful coffee shop in walking distance of the McColl Center for Art and Innovation and the Charlotte Ballet.

Adam (Co-Founder) greeted me with such a great vibe. The place is exactly what other are not and you can see it from their seating areas to the staff that works there, but most importantly - their coffee. I was trying to locate a printer and Adam without hesitation offered to help me with a quick print - talk about making folks comfortable. I'm not a "review guy" per say, but after this experience I felt compelled to share my experience! Love this place!
A fantastic space for relaxing or working. The coffee here is fantastic and the service is great as well. They also serve beer and food. The chili is great.
Great coffee and the breakfast is wonderful.  The atmosphere is perfect for a coffee meeting during the work week.
Lovely shop, great coffee

Super impressed with this place! Amazing environment, unique and fabulous coffee and personable staff. One of the best coffee shops I've been to lately. Get the cinnamon latte-the cayenne is a great touch!
A great experience at a great coffee shop! Single origin coffees. Nice and thick espresso. Awesome pastries, especially the cronut! If you are into good espresso this is the place for you.

This spot has quickly become one of my favorite places in town. The combination of F√ºd on the Move & Nightflyer Roastworks has seriously raised the bar for the food/drink scene in Charlotte. Tons of clearly-labeled vegan options.
Amazing coffee
I had the Silence of the Yams latte! It was so good! Also there Tuesday trivia night is bomb!

I have had their latte a few times now and it tastes a-ma-zing! They are consistent with their flavors, very friendly stuff, awesome design. It's a full package, folks! It's definitely worth checking it out!

Anyone that knows me and follows my music knows I drink a lot of coffee and I'm also a bit of a snob when it comes to my coffee, well I found a place that meets even my coffee shaming ways; Queen City Grounds! My sister-in-law told me about this place so I had to check it out and boy am I glad I did! Coffee was off the hook and my breakfast was even better! I loved the atmosphere and the barista was great! She took her time and I could tell she wanted me to have the best possible cup of coffee she could make for me. I highly recommend this coffee house!
Great spot! Nice staff! Yummy food!
Between the coffee options and amazing food I try to make it here at least once or twice a week. Great space to chill, get work done, or hangout with friends.
Great iced coffee and carrot cake! Everyone in our party loved what they ordered!

Great food and delicious, well made coffee (with homemade syrups!). Menu has lots of dairy free, vegetarian, and vegan options. They have a helpful and very curtious staff. Wine and beer (both draft and package) are available. Some outside patio seating as well. Not to mention they also hold lots of fun events!

Best coffee but horrible customer service. I went to this place more than 8 or 9 times but I don't like their customer service. Some cases customer services were ok but this past Friday was bad. I ordered an Americano and it took them 30 minutes to serve a cup of coffee. Also, when I went to ask one of the employee as to what's taking them so long, he completely ignored me. As if I don't exist. He finally served but never apologize for serving a cup of coffee that late. I decided to stop going as often as I do. I might try only once every two months.
Love this shop! One of the best spaces to sit and get work done in all of Charlotte.
Yummy lattes and the caprese toast was delicious!

Immediate 5 stars for the staff alone. They are cheerful, helpful, and make me want to come back. But the food is good (the tofu bahn mi was yum-yum), the coffee even better.  Free WiFi, beer in cans and draft, other non coffee drinks, killer looking pastries.

My coworker knows how much I love angood cup of coffee so he brought me a latte from Queen City grounds.... let me tell you something, this was probably one of the best lattes I have ever tried! Rich taste! Great quality! Highly recommend!!!! Will be stopping by quiet often now!
Outstanding coffee and tea shop that has a Zen ambiance and a superb,  knowledgeable staff.
Awesome espresso and great food!
Look forward to seeing them when in Charlotte. Try hot green tea. Presentation is awesome. Staff awesome.
Excellent coffee!

I wish I could give Queen City Grounds 6 stars. This place is absolutely incredible in every way. The location is top notch, the decor is unique, the atmosphere is inviting, and the employees are so friendly and personable.  The coffee is fantastic! All options available as well (espresso, drip, latte, etc.), with all sorts of dairy substitutes if preferred. My understanding is that most of the coffee is roasted in-house, through Nightflyer Roastworks. You'll even see the roasting station right when you walk in!  The food is excellent as well. All the sandwiches and gelato are homemade, and it seems like more than half are vegan or have vegan options. I'm not even vegan and I can honestly say one of the vegan sandwiches I got was out of this world. The homemade gelato is a hidden gem as well.  This is the type of spot Charlotte has needed for years, and I'm so glad Queen City Grounds finally opened. You won't regret a visit here!
This place knows coffee, especially iced coffee. I recommend the iced vanilla latte with almond milk!!

Do you want to chat with a friend, people watch, or get some work done? Do you want to sit in an arm chair, on a hightop stool, or on a couch? Coffee or tea? Inside or outside? At QCG, you'll find plenty of space and natural light, Nightflyer Roastworks, Fud on the Muv (formerly Fud at Salud), local kombucha and artwork, and Moxie Mercantile goodies. Most of the breakfast and lunch options can be made vegan and there is a rotating bake case with vegan and gf options as well. QCG is active on Instagram so that's a good way to keep up with them. Milk options: whole, almond, and oat. Smoothies, beer, and wine are also available. If you have any questions, the staff will kindly answer! QCG welcomes dogs (outside) and even has puppuccinos for them. Parking options: metered street parking or Skyhouse garage (make sure to get a validation slip from QCG). Enter through doors on N Church (W 10th is an exit only).
Come solo, with small or larger groups. Great vibe, cool staff, super space...and of course the coffee. Limited but appetizing food menu.
Great food, great coffee, great atmosphere.
Between the Banh and Me was awesome. I also really enjoyed the nitro cold brew.
Great coffee and food with staff to match!
Love this place. Stumbled upon it by accident... great breakfast food and coffee. Plus, the staff is so friendly. Cold brew & goat cheese and fig toast (in picture)

Absolutely love QCG! I'm so happy they're finally open at SkyHouse, although I've been enjoying their coffee for months now. The location is absolutely beautiful, a great cozy space for just relaxing, getting some work done, or meeting up with friends. All of the people at QCG are some of the nicest, most genuine people you'll ever meet. While I haven't had any of the food yet, I've had several of the coffee drinks and smoothies and everything has been perfect! Definitely my favorite coffee in Charlotte.
Awesome!
Great place to start your day!  Excellent coffee and food.  Very relaxing atmosphere with friendly people to greet you!
Great place! Coffee and my Mocha Latte was on point! The wrap I had was amazing. 100% recommended!
Tasty coffee and pastry. I live in Skyhouse with my Wife and we encourage you guys to do a special discount for the skyhouse residents. We will support your business either way. Good luck
Nice staff and treats. Pretty expansive food menu
Great coffee, food and extremely welcoming atmosphere. All staff very friendly and accommodating. Would definitely recommend.
